content: pattern notes ● the turning chain never counts as a stitch ● note that there is no ch1 space next to the beginning and ending scs there are ch1 spaces between each clsc3tog but not next to each single_crochet special stitches clsc3tog cluster single_crochet 3 together begin cluster in same stitch as previous stitch worked see photo tutorial below insert hook into same st or space as where the previous stitch ended yo pull up loop insert hook in next st or space yo pull up loop repeat 2x yo pull through all 4 loops on hook stsc stacked single_crochet single_crochet in the indicated st then without doing a yo insert your hook under the left-most diagonal bar of the single_crochet see image below yo and pull up a loop yo and complete a second single_crochet as normal these 2 scs will be stacked one on top of the other - the same height as a usual double_crochet - and will replace the turning ch3 which usually leaves a gap between itself and the next stitch will be counted as a double_crochet in the st/row count strip 1 - trinity stitch with ca ch18 row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook clsc3tog see special stitches starting in the same chain as the previous single_crochet *ch1 clsc3tog starting in the same chain as last leg of previous cluster* repeat from * to * across to last chain 8clsc3tog completed and no chs left then single_crochet in the same chain as last leg of the previous clsc3tog ch1 and turn 2sc 8clsc3tog 7ch1-sps row 2 single_crochet in �irst st clsc3tog starting in same st as previous single_crochet and then continuing in the top of the next cluster and ch1sp *ch1 clsc3tog starting in the last leg of previous clsc3tog* repeat from * to * across single_crochet in same st as last leg of previous clsc3tog ch1 and turn 2sc 8clsc3tog 7ch1-sps row 3-164 repeat row 2 border 1st edge - short side single_crochet in each stitch across to end 17sc work 2 more single_crochet in last st of the row to complete the corner turn strip ¼ turn to the right to work down the sides of row 2nd edge - long side single_crochet in the side of every row down the long side of the strip you ll notice convenient holes down the edge from the turning chains - place your stitches there 163 total scs - since one row was worked in the 3scs of the corner work 1 more single_crochet in the last st of the edge to complete the corner turn strip ¼ turn to the right to work in the opposite side of the starting chain 3rd edge -
